subject: Physics
questionText: A particle starts from rest and accelerates uniformly at 2 m/sÂ² for 5 seconds. What is its final velocity?

subject: Physics
questionText: Calculate the kinetic energy of a 5 kg mass moving at 4 m/s.

subject: Chemistry
questionText: What is the functional group in $\text{CH}_3\text{COOH}$?
solution: The $-\text{COOH}$ group is characteristic of a carboxylic acid (acetic acid in this case).

subject: Mathematics
solution:
Using the quadratic formula: $x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}$ where $a=2$, $b=-5$, $c=-3$. 
$x = \frac{5 \pm \sqrt{25 + 24}}{4} = \frac{5 \pm \sqrt{49}}{4} = \frac{5 \pm 7}{4}$. 
This gives $x = 3$ or $x = -0.5$.

subject: Chemistry
questionText: Which of the following processes always has a positive entropy change?
solution: Dissolution of salt in water increases disorder as the organized salt crystal breaks apart into ions dispersed throughout the solution, increasing entropy ($\Delta S > 0$).

subject: Physics
questionText: A charged particle moves perpendicular to a uniform magnetic field. Its path will be:
solution: When a charged particle moves perpendicular to a magnetic field, it experiences a force perpendicular to both its velocity and the field ($\vec{F} = q\vec{v} \times \vec{B}$). This creates a centripetal force causing circular motion.
